greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n if n = 1 or if n is prime. Otherwise, a(n) = 2 if n is even and a(n) = 3 if n is odd.
comment: The average value of a(n) is n/(2 log n) + O(n log log n/log^2 n). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 29 2014
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: a[n_] := If[PrimeQ[n] || n == 1, n, If[EvenQ[n], 2, 3] ]; Table[a[n], {n,1,25}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 26 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)=if(isprime(n)||n==1, n, if(n%2, 3, 2)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 29 2014
results.author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_, Dec 01 2007
